did.unittitle: Mary Perry Smith Black Filmmakers Hall of Fame Archives Collection, Series 8. Board and Committee Documents

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Black Filmmakers Hall of Fame, Inc.

did.abstract: This series contains documents generated by the Black Filmmakers Hall of Fame Board of Directors and various committees.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The materials in this series are open to the public.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The Black Filmmakers Hall of Fame, Inc. (BFHFI) was founded in Oakland, California in 1974. The BFHFI began as a collaboration among Roy Thomas from the Afro-American Studies Department at UC-Berkeley, Mary Perry Smith, who was the co-chairperson of the Cultural and Ethnic Affairs Guild and at the Oakland Museum, and Sonny Buxton of the San Francisco Bay Area station KGO-TV.

The BFHFI identified itself as an organization "dedicated to influencing Black images portrayed in film and television through education, the nurturing of current independent filmmakers and the preservation of contributions by Black artists" (BFHFI 20th Anniversary Celebration Program). Throughout its existence the BFHFI presented award ceremonies honoring contemporary and historic figures in black filmmaking. Notable programs established by the BFHFI include the Oscar Micheaux Awards Ceremony, the International Black Film, Video & Screenplay Competition, the Black Filmworks International Film Festival, and the Sidney Poitier Fellowship. Additionally, educational programs, various symposia, and lecture series on black film were conducted throughout the life of the organization.

The BFHFI initially operated in partnership with the Oakland Museum, later incorporating itself as an independent, non-profit organization in 1978. Attempts to establish a dedicated museum and permanent home for the BFHFI were ultimately unsuccessful, although the BFHFI did begin acquisition of collections for this proposed museum.

The final Oscar Micheaux Awards ceremony was held in 1993, the 20th anniversary of the founding of the event. The BFHFI continued to present the Black Filmworks International Film Festival and Black Independent Film, Video & Screenplay Competition through 2003.

For a more detailed administrative history, a biography for Mary Perry Smith, and a listing of other series, please see collection overview (http://purl.dlib.indiana.edu/iudl/findingaids/bfca/VAD4347).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in the following series with this series is arranged into six subseries:

list.item: -- Subseries 8.1. Board of Director documents, approximately 1975-2004
Subseries 8.2. Memos sent to BFHFI Board of Directors members, approximately 1974-2007
-- Subseries 8.5. Long-range, marketing, and strategic plans, 1983-2005

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This series contains documents generated by the Board of Directors of the Black Filmmakers Hall of Fame and its various committees. Also included are board documents created by the Oakland Museum's Cultural and Ethnic Affairs Guild in 1974 through the incorporation of the BFHFI in 1978. The generation of documents appears to have ceased with the effective end of the Board of Directors' operations in 2007. In addition to meeting agendas, minutes, memos, and committee documents, this series also contains reports and proposals presented to the board from 1976-1993, various planning documents generated between 1983-2005, and documents generated by and presented to the board regarding the potential purchase and renovation of a building for the BFHFI. This building was intended to permanently house the BFHFI and a museum that would exhibit memorabilia related to Hall of Fame inductees, the history of African American filmmakers and filmmaking, and other black artists involved in the film industry.

Additional committee documents directly related to specific BFHFI events may also be found in the series for those events (see main collection overview at http://purl.dlib.indiana.edu/iudl/findingaids/bfca/VAD4347 for complete series listing).

relatedmaterial.head: Related material
relatedmaterial.p: A few additional committee documents related to the 1975 Oscar Micheaux Awards Ceremony are located in the Belva Davis and William Moore Black Filmmakers Hall of Fame Archives Collection (COL 4), which is also held by the BFC/A (http://purl.dlib.indiana.edu/iudl/findingaids/archives/VAD4434).

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The material in this series is part of a collection donated by Mary Perry Smith to the Indiana University Black Film Center Archives in January 2014.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: 2016 accruals are located in box AC 2.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Materials may be used in-house at the BFC/A; duplication permitted only with permission of the Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [item], Mary Perry Smith Black Filmmakers Hall of Fame Archives Collection, Special Collection COL 5, Black Film Center/Archive, Indiana University, Bloomington.

controlaccess.subject: Blacks in the motion picture industry
Board of directors
Motion pictures--Congresses

unittitle.extref: 2. Oscar Micheaux Awards Ceremony and Gala
4. Black Filmworks and Independent Film, Video & Screenplay Competition

scopecontent.head: Content
scopecontent.p: Includes by-laws, articles of incorporation, long-range planes, agendas, minutes, meeting notes, official memorandum, and reports and proposals presented at meeting of the BFHFI Board of Directors. Early board documents from the Oakland Museum from 1975-1978, are also included.

Oakland Museum Association by-laws and revision recommendations
A Member Study of the Oakland Museum Association
Membership Committee proposal packet for Board of Directors' retreat
Board of Directors and Development Committee work session

scopecontent.head: Content
scopecontent.p: Includes meetings with Development Committee and plans for BFHFI building.

8.2. Memos sent to BFHFI Board of Directors members

scopecontent.head: Content
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence addressed to Board not official labelled as memos.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Many committee documents were deeply integrated with the documentation for the BFHFI's events and activities and may be found within series throughout the collection.
